BSCreature.sDescription:
Stirge
DESCRIPTION: Common and Humming Stirges are blood drinkers.
Both varieties have pincher-like legs used ro land on victims and a needle-
like beak that they use to jab an artery and drink blood. Humming
Stirges have humming bird wings and are much faster, but very small.
COMBAT/TACTIC~: Common Stirge: Due to rheir ability to find and
attack weak points, Stirges attack as 4 Hit Dice monsters. Their noses inflict ld4-1 points ofdamage on a hit and then drain 1-4 points every
round thereafter. When a Stirge drains 12 points of blood, it is bloated
and flies away to digest.
If anyone other than the victim attempts to strike a Stirge, he must roll
against the AC of the victim at -2 (in addition to his normal attack
roll). If he succeeds, he avoids hitting the victim as well as the Stirge.
If he fails, he hits the victim (whether he hits the Stirge or not).
